comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: Sacajawea Statue – Then & Now (101 years later) One of the more remarkable women in American history, this bronze statue of Sacajawea and her son, Jean-Baptiste, by Alice Cooper (Hubbard) was unveiled on July 6, 1905.  After the close of the Lewis and Clark Exposition it was moved to Portland's Washington Park on April 6, 1906, where it stands today. "Sacajawea Statue (1905)"              "Sacajawea Statue (2006)" by Kiet Callies

comment.author: 88887525@N00
comment._content: Thanks for the information. What a beautiful statue! If you're ever near Dayton in eastern Washington you might be interested in the metal work display there showing the Lewis & Clark party camping along side Patit Creek, complete with the dog, Sacajawea, and her little boy. Here's an article if you want to read more about it seattletimes.nwsource.com/html/outdoors/2002432518_nwwday...
